test.title: IPA Graphite Font Tests

introduction.p: IPA was the first font developed with Graphite. It is used to represent every sound a human can make to communicate. IPA is used in the field for language survey, language acquisition and study.

context.p: Often times bugs in this font are isolated but may affect the placement or appearance of many characters in a view. Try to report the bug in its most elemental form.

guidelines.p: There is no project specification for this font.

case.title: IPA Inspection
case.p: Visual inspection of the appearance and position of each character is important to insure all are displayable.
case.step:
Click File-Open and browse for IPA_Table.wpx. Click OK. Inspect the appearance of each character against the chart. IPA chart to compare characters. Each character should match.
The IPA_Table.xml file should be in the same directory as this test file.
IPA character <code> has incorrect appearance

case.title: IPA Keyboarding

context.p: When WorldPad is running and the main view is empty

case.p: Every character must be keyboarded to prove it can be.
case.step:
Use the IPA keyboarding codes to enter all characters. Each character should be displayed by the indicated code.
Keyman has to be set up and running to allow keyboarding using the codes.
IPA character <code> does not key character

Use the IPA keyboarding codes to enter all diacritics. Each diacritic should be displayed by the indicated code.
IPA diacritic <code> does not key character

Use a Czech IPA paragraph to test the use of the IPA font. Type the paragraph using the keyman codes from the previous steps. It should be possible to type fluidly without a lot of difficult associations or odd finger reaching. It may take a little getting used to.
IPA <code> is not easy to use entering a string of text
